funnelStages.stageDescription: Confirms the primary diagnosis of advanced, non-squamous NSCLC without targetable mutations, which is the most restrictive criterion.
Evaluates the patient's treatment history to ensure they meet the trial's line of therapy requirements.
Assesses the patient's overall fitness, life expectancy, and extent of disease, including CNS involvement and measurability.
Verifies fundamental patient characteristics and history that could impact eligibility.
Screens for specific pre-existing conditions and known hypersensitivities that would pose a safety risk.
Confirms adequate organ function via lab tests and ensures consent for mandatory tissue sample provision.
Final verification of patient's ability to consent, comply with study procedures, and meet reproductive health requirements.

logicalGroups.criterionText: Subject must be ≥ 18 years of age.
logicalGroups.clinicalName: Minimum Age of 18 Years

logicalGroups.criterionText: Life expectancy > 12 weeks (as per Investigator's clinical assessment).
logicalGroups.clinicalName: Life Expectancy Greater Than 12 Weeks

logicalGroups.criterionText: Subject must have cytologically or histologically confirmed advanced or metastatic non-squamous NSCLC. Subjects with mixed histology tumors will be eligible if the tumor is predominant non-squamous histology and does not include tumor with small cell histology. Subjects must have a pathologist's report confirming non-squamous NSCLC available for collection by the sponsor. Subjects with EGFR mutation (exon 19 deletion or L858R mutation in exon 21) and/or ALK gene rearrangement must have progresse
logicalGroups.clinicalName: Confirmed Advanced or Metastatic Non-Squamous NSCLC

logicalGroups.criterionText: Subject must have NSCLC that is not amenable to surgical resection or radiation with curative intent at time of study Screening.
logicalGroups.clinicalName: NSCLC Not Amenable to Curative Therapy

logicalGroups.criterionText: Subjects must be current smokers (defined as having > 100 smoking events lifetime and having smoked within the past year) or former smokers (defined as having > 100 smoking events lifetime and having not smoked within the past year).
logicalGroups.clinicalName: Current or Former Smoking History

logicalGroups.criterionText: Subject must have at least 1 unidimensional measurable NSCLC lesion on a CT scan as defined by RECIST (version 1.1).
logicalGroups.clinicalName: Measurable Disease by RECIST 1.1

logicalGroups.criterionText: Subject must consent to provide archived tissue or cytology sample of NSCLC lesion (primary or metastatic) for analysis if available.
logicalGroups.clinicalName: Consent for Tumor Tissue Sample Provision

logicalGroups.criterionText: Subject must have no history of brain metastases or evidence of CNS tumors at screening assessment. Subjects with signs or symptoms of CNS involvement will undergo MRI (or CT scan if MRI is contraindicated) to confirm absence of CNS metastases.
logicalGroups.clinicalName: Absence of Brain Metastases or CNS Tumors

logicalGroups.criterionText: Subject must have an Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) Performance Score of 0 – 1.
logicalGroups.clinicalName: ECOG Performance Status of 0 or 1

logicalGroups.criterionText: Subjects with fluid retention, including ascites or pleural effusion, may be allowed at the discretion of the Investigator.
logicalGroups.clinicalName: Fluid Retention Permitted at Investigator Discretion
Adequate Hematologic, Renal, and Hepatic Function

logicalGroups.criterionText: Female subjects of childbearing potential (i.e., those who are not postmenopausal for at least 1 year or surgically sterile by bilateral tubal ligation, bilateral oophorectomy or hysterectomy) and their male partners should practice at least one of the methods of birth control listed below during study and for at least 6 months after treatment with paclitaxel chemotherapy. Male subjects and their female partners of childbearing potential should practice at least one of the methods of birth contr
logicalGroups.clinicalName: Contraception Requirements for Men and Women

logicalGroups.criterionText: Subject must be capable of understanding and complying with parameters as outlined in the protocol and able to sign and date the informed consent approved by an Independent Ethics Committee (IEC)/Institutional Review Board (IRB), prior to the initiation of any screening or study-specific procedures.
logicalGroups.clinicalName: Ability to Provide Informed Consent and Comply

logicalGroups.criterionText: Subject has a known hypersensitivity to paclitaxel or to other drugs formulated with polyethoxylated castor oil (Cremophor).
logicalGroups.clinicalName: Known Hypersensitivity to Paclitaxel or Excipients

logicalGroups.criterionText: Subject has a known hypersensitivity to platinum compounds.
logicalGroups.clinicalName: Known Hypersensitivity to Platinum Compounds

logicalGroups.criterionText: Subjects with peripheral neuropathy ≥ grade 2.
logicalGroups.clinicalName: Significant Pre-existing Peripheral Neuropathy

logicalGroups.criterionText: Subjects with squamous NSCLC, or those with an untreated EGFR mutation (exon 19 deletion or L858R mutation in exon 21) and/or ALK gene rearrangement. Subjects' EGFR mutation and ALK gene rearrangement status must be known prior to study entry.
logicalGroups.clinicalName: Exclusion of Squamous NSCLC or Untreated Driver Mutations

logicalGroups.criterionText: A history of seizure within 12 months prior to study entry.
logicalGroups.clinicalName: History of Seizure Within 12 Months

logicalGroups.criterionText: Subject has received prior cytotoxic chemotherapy or chemoradiotherapy for NSCLC, except adjuvant or neoadjuvant therapy > 12 months prior to C1D-2, or subject has received targeted small molecule monotherapy for EGFR and/or ALK-positive disease ≤ 14 days prior to C1D-2 or biologic therapy ≤ 21 days prior to C1D-2.
logicalGroups.clinicalName: Prior Systemic or Radiotherapy for NSCLC

logicalGroups.criterionText: Subject has received anti-cancer Chinese medicine or anti-cancer herbal remedies within 14 days prior to C1D-2.
logicalGroups.clinicalName: Recent Use of Anti-Cancer Herbal Remedies

logicalGroups.criterionText: Subject has undergone focal External Beam Radiation Therapy (EBRT) to bone ≤ 2 weeks prior to C1D-2; or subject has undergone EBRT to larger fields (i.e., 100 cm² to thorax) ≤ 4 weeks prior to C1D-2.
logicalGroups.clinicalName: Recent External Beam Radiation Therapy

logicalGroups.criterionText: Any medical condition, which in the opinion of the Investigator, places the subject at an unacceptably high risk for toxicities, or any subject circumstance which prohibits trial participation according to local law.
logicalGroups.clinicalName: Unacceptable Risk per Investigator's Judgment

logicalGroups.criterionText: Subject is pregnant or lactating.
logicalGroups.clinicalName: Pregnancy or Lactation

logicalGroups.criterionText: Subject has previously been treated with a PARP inhibitor.
logicalGroups.clinicalName: Prior PARP Inhibitor Treatment

logicalGroups.criterionText: The subject has a history of another cancer within the past 3 years except cervical cancer in situ, in situ carcinoma of the bladder, squamous or basal cell carcinoma of the skin or another in situ cancer that is considered cured by the Investigator (e.g., in situ prostate cancer).
logicalGroups.clinicalName: History of Other Malignancy Within 3 Years
